differential_diagnosis: Soft-tissue sarcoma, possible leiomyosarcoma or malignant fibrous histiocytoma
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's clinical history and imaging findings of a well-circumscribed mass in the retroperitoneum led to the primary consideration of soft-tissue sarcoma due to the distinct nature of the mass and absence of typical symptoms for other conditions. Histopathological examination confirmed the diagnosis of Castleman’s disease, hyaline-vascular type.
